intro: Paullinia ribesiicarpa, commonly known as the Brazilian star apple, is a tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the Sapindaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves with alternate arrangement. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a spherical, spiny structure that turns red when ripe, containing a sweet, starchy pulp. The botanical features of Paullinia ribesiicarpa make it an interesting subject for both ecological and horticultural study.
